artist: Artist: Hashiguchi Goyō; Carver: Keyblock carved by Koike Masazō; Carver: Color blocks carved by Maeda Kentarō; Printer: Hirai Kōichi; Producer: Posthumously produced by Hashiguchi Yasuo
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and shoulders of a woman leaning on a railing; woman wears blue and white kimono with leaf designs and a gold ring with a red stone; foliage with pink flowers behind figure
inscription: 大正九年七月 {Taishō kunen shichigatsu} (July 1920)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica and embossing
text: Artwork dated to July 1920 but first posthumously printed in 1952. Portrait of Nakatani Tsuru 中谷つる.
title: At a Hot Springs Inn
